about_the_game:
Inspired by the story of Pachacutec, the great Inca who transformed the Andean world, Inka Aventura: Saga de Pachakutiq is a 2D indie platform adventure video game that captures the aesthetics of the Inca culture.

In this game, you will be able to control Cusi Yupanqui, the future king Pachakutiq, in his first adventures. You will travel through passages and achievements of his life, from his humble origins to his rise to power.

The video game will have a 2D isometric level design, which will allow you to explore the beautiful landscapes of the Andes. You will be able to move in two directions, vertically and horizontally, and use skills that will be unlocked as you progress through the game.

Throughout your journey, you will face various challenges, such as dangerous enemies, deadly traps, and obstacles that you must overcome. You will also have to learn how to use Cusi Yupanqui's abilities to solve puzzles and advance in the game.

Inka Adventure: Saga of Pachakutiq is a challenging and exciting game that will transport you to the world of Inca culture.

History:
After the rebellion of the Chancas, which occurred around the year 1430, the Inca people in Cusco were greatly weakened and their dominance over other cultures was called into question. The God Wiraqocha will test the crown prince Cusi Yupanqui to find out if the Inca people are going to become a great Empire or if they are going to remain just another of the peoples of the Andes.

The test that the God Wiraqocha has imposed a challenge on the prince seems simple: he must pacify his four of the Inca people. If he succeeds, the prophecy says that Cusi Yupanquí will be the next great King of the Incas with the name of Pachakutiq, the Inca who will transform the land so that the Inca Curacazgo becomes the Tahuantinsuyo Empire, the great Empire of the Incas which will have the city of Cusco as the capital of the great kingdom of the Andes.

The first great challenge that Cusi Yupanqui decides to face is to finish dominating the Chancas, the warrior people who have hidden in the Antisuyo, taking advantage of the jungle to protect themselves.

After his victory at Antisuyo, his gaze turns to the southern Andes, whose region is known as Collasuyo and where several Aymara peoples lived, the people of his ancestors. It was important for Prince Cusi Yupanqui to demonstrate the power that the Inca people had achieved and that the love for the Incas would return to the hearts of the Aymaras.

The victorious army of Cusi Yupanqui returns through the Collasuyo region to add to the Inca Curacazgo all the towns up to the Nazca region, a region where today the famous Nazca lines are located.

The last great battle that Prince Cusi Yupanquí had to carry out was the conquest of the Chimus people, in the Chinchaysuyo region, a town of goldsmiths and warriors who had provided support to the Chancas in the past.

If he manages to defeat the people of the four kingdoms, Cusi Yupanqui will become the great Pachakutiq and will be the founder of the Tahuantinsuyo Empire. If he fails, the Incas will be lost to history.
